intro: Comanthera tricostata, commonly known as the three-costate comanthera, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a distinctive three-lobed base. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have a yellowish or greenish hue with prominent stamens. Comanthera tricostata is often found in grasslands and rocky outcrops, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
